column5: Here's a few to look at...I've cropped them the best I can, so if you recognize the spot good for you -  fish it in the spring when it's open again.        By far the most fun fish in the river.  Kemper
Cool, I like the last shot the best
Great shots!  I've still yet to catch a coho in the tribs.  Not much of a run in my typical haunts, it seems.
Love cohos. Beautiful photos, especially the last one.
Same here.........Ive always dug cohos. Dont seem to ever find consistant catches of them in my area either.
I don't miss steelheading to much but I certainly miss traveling up to LLSP to fish for coho's.
Sweet fish Brady. Didn't manage to get out very much this fall, but I haven't seen a coho run like the one this year in a heck of a long time. I really like the last shot

Very nice, another fan of cohos in the tribs.  They seem to make it farther upstream in better shape than the chinook boots, that actually fight more like a boot too  Watch for period runs of coho thoughout the fall, years ago one of the biggest influx of cohos happened just b4 freeze up.
THERE GOES MY SECRET HOLE  LOL NICE FISH BRO
YOU JUST SPOILED THE ENTIRE LAKE ONTARIO STEELHEAD FISHERY BY POSTING PICS FROM THAT SUPER DUPER SECRET SPOT!!!!!   Nice fish dude!
Dang Bill, l2p is going to be real mad...he took me there!  Par, I have more pics that Anes took but there is some graffiti that would give it away for sure
Fine looking coho there. Grew up pretty close to there. It was great for spring steelhead in late 80's.
I love this shot. Well done!  p.-
All photo credit goes to l2p on these ones! Thanks buddy  I rarely photo my own fish anymore, especially if I am fishing solo...too many cameras lost to the depths
To echo other members responses, the last shot is amazing.  I have yet to hook my first coho!  -Sawyer
